briefdescription.para: Constructs a newly allocated Pipe object.

memberdef.argsstring: (const string &name, const Tango::DispLevel level, const PipeWriteType pwt=PIPE_READ)
memberdef.name: Pipe

briefdescription.para: Constructs a newly allocated Pipe object from its name and its display level.

parameterdescription.para: The pipe R/W type (default to READ)

description.para: Only one destructor is defined for this class
These methods allows the external world to get/set Pipe instance data members

briefdescription.para: Return the pipe name in lower case letters.
Return the root data blob name.
Set the root data blob name.

detaileddescription.para: This method allows the user to choose the pipe serialization model.

parameterdescription.para: The new serialisation model. The serialization model must be one of PIPE_BY_KERNEL, PIPE_BY_USER or PIPE_NO_SYNC

detaileddescription.para: This method allows the user to give to the pipe object the pointer to the omni_mutex used to protect its buffer. The mutex has to be locked when passed to this method. The Tango kernel will unlock it when the data will be transferred to the client.

briefdescription.para: Insert data into a device pipe.

detaileddescription.para: Inserting data into a Pipe instance is simlar to inserting data into a DevicePipeBlob class instance. See doc of DevicePipeBlob class insertion methods (DevicePipeBlob::operator<<) to get a complete documentation on how to insert data into a Pipe object

parameterdescription.para: The data to be inserted into the Pipe object

detaileddescription.para: Set the blob data element number

briefdescription.para: Set blob data element number and names.

detaileddescription.para: Set the blob data element number and names. The data element number is the number of names in the input parameter.
Get the blob data element number

sectiondef.header: Exception and error related methods methods

detaileddescription.para:
It's a method which allows the user to switch on/off exception throwing when trying to insert/extract data from a Pipe object. The following flags are supported :
isempty_flag - throw a WrongData exception (reason = API_EmptyDataElement) if user tries to extract data from one empty blob data element. By default, this flag is set
wrongtype_flag - throw a WrongData exception (reason = API_IncompatibleArgumentType) if user tries to extract data with a type different than the type used for insertion. By default, this flag is set
notenoughde_flag - throw a WrongData exception (reason = API_PipeWrongArg) if user tries to extract data from a DevicePipeBlob for a data element which does not exist. By default, this flag is set
blobdenamenotset_flag - Throw a WrongData exception (reason = API_PipeNoDataElement) if user tries to insert data into the blob while the name or number of data element has not been set with methods set_data_elt_nb() or set_data_elt_names()
mixing_flag - Throw a WrongData exception (reason = API_NotSupportedFeature) if user tries to mix insertion/extraction method (<< or >>) with operator[]
fl
The exception flag
Sets one exception flag. See DevicePipeBlob::exceptions() for a usage example.
Allow the user to check if insertion/extraction into/from Pipe instance was successfull. This method has to be used when exceptions are disabled.

briefdescription.para: The pipe name in lower case.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *, const CORBA::String_member &, string &, vector< Attribute::AttPropDb > &, vector< PipeProperty > &, vector< PipeProperty > &, const char *)
memberdef.name: set_one_str_prop

briefdescription.para: This class is a class representing a pipe in the TANGO device server pattern.

detaileddescription.para: It is an abstract class. It is the root class for all pipe related classes.
